title: What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
preds:
Wow! what a turn!
Very nice performance towards the end of year
It's not impossible, but I think it's highly unlikely this stock will drop $5.30 tomorrow.  Especially considering it is up $0.69 after hours.
It's not all that volatile of a stock day to day

The major potential cloud on the near-term horizon is a ruling by a New Jersey judge regarding witness eligibility.  It could come today or months from now.  Meanwhile analysts are raising the target price, and the stock appears to be following the broader end-of-the-year melt up. The stock would have to drop 4.4% in the next 4 1/2 trading days to miss. Definitely not impossible, but I am betting against it.
Only 10 calendar days left for the question. Stock price is very near 52-week high, has not been below $140 in about ten days. https://www.bloomberg.com/quote/JNJ:US
1/3/20 141/140 put spreads and 140/139 put spreads ~$0.065 and ~$0.045 respectively vs. 146.34 stock. Seems fairish to a shade rich.

The animal spirits are loose in the land.  Fear of missing out has started to take hold.  Investors are looking for any reason to invest in something.  In this context, Barron's is running a story about a Morgan Stanley analyst who says the market is mis-pricing JNJ...that legal liabilities are overestimated, and 2020 earnings are set to take off.  Other analysts have raised recommendations.  With the stock at $146+ and only 6 1/2 trading days left in the year, I am forecasting it will stay above $140.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
What, me worry! What could possibly go wrong in 10 trading days?
THose Soap on a rope gift packs must be selling hotcakes...
Don't fight the tape, just relax and enjoy the ride, unless you are short.

The animal spirits are loose in the land.  Fear of missing out has started to take hold.  Investors are looking for any reason to invest in something.  In this context, Barron's is running a story about a Morgan Stanley analyst who says the market is mis-pricing JNJ...that legal liabilities are overestimated, and 2020 earnings are set to take off.  With the stock at $143+ and only 8 1/2 trading days left in the year, I am forecasting it will stay above $140.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
Close Dec 17 = 143.56 as the insanity called "year-end" rally continues. I'll play the game and move my marker toward the market while holding my nose. Voting with percentage costs less than voting with dollars.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
Hmmm......enthusiastic investors obviously haven't thought about what will actually happen next year. Perhaps they wll sober up in the next 10 trading days.

With 12 trading days left, I think that JNJ will go with the market. And the market has some tailwinds with the recent Fed rate decision, the House Democrats supporting the USMCA deal, and now Trump and China appearing to be kissing and making up.  Of course, with Trump one never knows.  But with Christmas approaching, it might be reasonable to assume he's going to give the country a bit of a break from his trade rants (not to mention the fact that he has some impending impeachment items to concern himself with).

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
Dec 10 JNJ at $139.99 straddling the buckets. Could be slight errosion in price from here in a tepid year-end market.

Having shaken off the asbestos legal issue, the stock is back in the running.  Given it's earnings earlier this autumn, the rising market, and the fact that it's broken out of the $130K - $140K range, I think the odds are shifting.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
On a down day, JNJ managed an uptick to $140.50 an impressive achievement when it's peers are under pressure.
Perhaps funds will bid for more JNJ to make their books look good for year-end.
Lawsuits against J&J will bring stocks down.

With the general uptick in stock performance and the looming legal crises on the horizon, j&j will maintain or continue trending upwards minus a major market pullback which is unlikely due to holiday season market sentiment and President Trump's methods of generating wins off of seemingly negative economic press.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019? 
"To the moon Alice!"
I think we are getting a littel carried away here, but fighting the tape at this point is pointless.
With about 3 weeks of trading remaining will tariffs, UK vote, or Fed actions impact it - not likely.

Empirically stock not being significantly impacted by additional talc headlines (12/4/19 Reuters headlines highlighting FDA standing by its testing methodology and actions taken). Still risk due to material changes to risk landscape and beta, but moving my +140 prob up significantly.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
Bloomberg Dec 5 $139.56 - the very top of the fifth bucket....will it tip over to the sixth bucket by year-end?
I'll update my forecast just in case, but I really think it won't end there.

155 tests from two independent laboratories has ruled out asbestos in JNJ's baby powder.  The asbestos issue has been a drag on the stock since October.  This may release some pent-up bullish sentiment.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
I seem to have underestimated the market's enthusiasm for stocks. We'll see if it persists.
Dec 4 price is $139.16.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
The market is finally correcting it's excess, if its a 10% correction, similar to last year's 8% we'd get:
137.2 - 13.7 = 123.5. While this is extreme, even a 5% correction from here would be 130.3.
My guess we've seen the highs for the year - unless you can think of a positive event occuring?

An analysis of 13Fs, showing hedge fund and institutional holdings, indicates slightly increased support for JNJ.  Although this is a lagging indicator, it seems consistent with the fact the stock held after a recent court ruling against it in the vaginal mesh implant case. I am discounting the two worst-case scenarios and distributing the risk evenly around the status quo.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
Anticipate market to erode during the month, but there could always be a pop as books are closed.
Based on current price. Historically there has been a dip in Dec
Sub 110 node rounds to 0. Sub 15 annualized volatility to 1/3/20 expiration.
What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019? J&J appears to be weathering the current storm very well - a strong market helps.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
The stock market has entered the silly twilight zone where everything looks incredible. Cannot say it will last for another 6 weeks but it might.

My prediction scale gives a target price on dec 31 of $140.58. It takes in account anything that happened with the stock price from sept 24th to nov 22th.
My prediction model upper limit $158.41 and my lower limit $122.62
Between nov 26th 2019 and dec 31, my forcast model gives a price range of $138,$142 and ending with $140.58.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019? Market at all time highs with drugs coming back into favor. Year end selling has not yet kicked in. Where does more good news come from? I am holding my nose as I make this forecast.

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019?
Current market is at all time highs, doubtful we can go much higher from here in the current climate.
Bloomberg put Nov 20 price at $136 smack in the middle of the  fifth range. A 10% correction would put it at $122.
Even a 5% correction would put it in the lower bucket. I will favor the 5-10% correction between now and year end.
Current price is about $135. This one is still a crap shoot, but will become more clear as the deadline approaches.
Updating based on most recent week stock quotes from Yahoo Finance
Updated for most recent market data.
Updated using weekly data from Yahoo Finance

What will be the end-of-day closing stock price of Johnson & Johnson on 31 December 2019? 
A solid company under fire. I agree with @petequinn analysis, its a crap shoot.

JNJ is currently quite volatile and the volatility centers on $130.00. The long term trend suggests that it could go above $140 but recent problems will likely hold it down. I think that the likelihood of the stock dropping below $120 is higher than going above $140.

Price has been hovering around $130, plus or minus $3 to 5, since July. This one looks like a crapshoot, nearly 50-50 chance to land above or below $130, with some (smaller) chance to jump more than $10 away from that line.

~~~
Outside View
~~~ Random walk model based on historical daily price changes: 0, 2, 14, 36, 33, 15 ~~~
Inside View
~~~ J&J has been underperforming its sector according to Bloomberg, in particular due to litigation risk on the upside due to opioid related lawsuits. The Board tried to restore trust recently with a buy-back, which helps their case. The stock hit the vicinity of the $127 level twice in the last few months but recovered from there and has stayed above the year-to-date low of $125, and meanwhile banks, including Goldman, which has one of the best reputations, have buy or hold ratings on it, which suggests to me that the market is seeing limits on how much the litigation can depress the stock.
Patents expiring on several drugs and devices
Based on historic price and recent stories about asbestos not being found

This is a strong blue chip company that's currently suffering from litigation. The stock has been more or less staying in the 130 - 140 range all year, with just a few spurts up.   It beat earnings estimates handily on 15 Oct, but still didn't break out of the range.  With the next earnings report not happening until January, there's really not much that I can see happening during the remainder of the year that might cause it to break out upward (although it's certainly possible). If it's going to leave the range, I think the more likely scenario is a move downward due to more currently unforeseen legal issues.

consumer trends - JNJ is global with little competition with a broad product mix - under valued due to litigation which will be delayed or If resolved not consequential to stock value. geopolitical risk - rapid advances in developing countries will amplify JNJ earnings., and shifts in the regulatory environment - the CDC will impose more rigor on consumer heath products which could reduce supply, discouraging competition and make JNJ more valuable.
I've given too much weight to litigation. JNJ is a strong safe blue chip stock and will go up with the market.
Redid forecast from last time with updated data.

JNJ down ~50 bps with market up 75 bps on strongish economic data. Additional detail on Warren healthcare plan proposal released, but still see IBB and XLV rallying. Reducing my probability for higher stock price nodes to something closer to market implied.
Litigation is my principal concern but Trefis valuation is $160 so might be way undervalued.
Press release from JNJ highlighting lack of asbestos in recalled Johnson's Baby Powder.
The historical data of JNJ's stocks shows that there is not much volatility below 130 neither above 140. The stocks must fall between this interval.

Pros: steady stock, room for dividend growth, well known brand. Climbing valuation for decades. P to E ratio is reasonable. Cons: Opiod crisis. Anti psychosis drugs that give men breasts. Asbestos talc. Vaginal mesh that causes bleeding. A brand built on trust undermined by corporate negligence. Potential 40 billion dollar hit in law suits. Summary: stock will rise while the guys at the wheel have the finger on the scales in theit favour... but theres no coincidence that one company has so much bad press against them, you have to ask whats next on the bad PR list. Who knows, they could be commiting fraud too? I'm really scepticle about companies like this and its influencing my decision making but this stinks of enron/BP/insertsupposedlystablecorporatebrandthatleteveryonedownhere. (Disclaimer: I know why the stock should drop, but i can tell you now, that it will go up before the reasons why kick in)

Considering trend from last 5 years, it has high potential to go close to $140. A slight dip is past few months denote possible uptick, but cautiously considering their corporate strategy, product diversity, reach and market conditions it is likely to remain between $120 and $130 provided overall market falls based on factors such as political volatility and other miscellaneous factors.

My estimates are based on the rough (by eyeball) proportions of time the share price has been in the various price ranges since early 2017, with small allowances at the low end (which have not been seen in that period). This is a pretty stable stock.

J&J has taken a hit this year given the lawsuits of its various products. Despite this the price holds steady above 120, even following the rulings against the pharma giant and recalls of products. The US and global economy is also showing signs of weakness, which is historically seen to have a small impact on the share price. However, news headlines are forgotten quickly, and given the widespread usage of its products, it is more likely for the price of J&J to recover above 130, rather than further drops to less than 120. It is improbable for the price to drop below 100 even in the case of a GFC, which in itself is highly unlikely before EOY.

J&J hasn't closed below $110/share since April, 2016 (https://www.bloomberg.com/quote/JNJ:US) Also, possibly some "good news" for the company -- but only if their reported agreements hold. Article excerpt: "The drug company Johnson & Johnson confirmed in an SEC filing on Wednesday night that it had reached an agreement in principle with four state attorneys general to settle all opioid claims against the company for $4 billion, and cut its previously-reported third quarter earnings to reflect the possible deal." (Source link: https://www.barrons.com/articles/johnson-johnson-jnj-cuts-earnings-in-late-night-filing-on-opioid-settlement-51571930284) ... But also some (more) 'bad' news/publicity (link): https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-25/walmart-cvs-pulling-j-j-baby-powder-off-shelves-amid-recall ...Despite the recent bad news for the company its stock has traded in (approx.) a $127-144 range over the past six months. (https://www.bloomberg.com/quote/JNJ:US)

Using data from [1] I estimated stock returns for a 45 day period (about the number of business days between now and the question end date).  I got the following distribution:  Less than 100: 0%
100 - 110: 2%
110 - 120: 15%
120 - 130: 33%
130 - 140: 31%
140+ : 18%  I'm going to scale down my answers a little bit simply because this question is probably only going to be asked during bad times for the company, rather than during smooth sailing periods.  [1] https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/JNJ/johnson-johnson/stock-price-history
~17-18 annualized volatility in Jan, exacerbated by recent talc headlines.
